citations.narrative:
On 02 August 2025, an approximately 1-year-old female Red-crested finch was unable to be found in an outdoor walk-
through aviary during morning observation checks. The bird had a history of getting into a keeper hallway and separate
large bird (vulture) portion of the aviary since acquisition and release into the aviary in May 2025. The facility assessed
the construction of the aviary and made repairs where gaps existed between dividing poles and netting within the aviary to
separate the two groups of birds.
Despite recovery efforts, the facility was unable to locate the bird or determine the cause of disappearance. The facility
patched areas of the semi-rigid plastic mesh enclosure material in disrepair and an area with minor gaps at the base of
the aviary wall, but a facility representative stated they did not think the areas they identified were large enough to allow
the bird to escape. The facility reports that ongoing corrective action measures are in place, including addressing a larger
gap (approximately 2.5 inches) at the base of the enclosure identified by the inspector during inspection.
The facility must ensure that bird enclosures are maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds,
and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within.
Correct from this date forward of 25 August 2025.

On the morning of 05 March 2025, Msituni, a 3-year-old female giraffe jumped out of the giraffe enclosure by clearing an
approximately 5-foot 10-inch vertical earth wall present on one side of the enclosure. The location that was breached did
not have additional containment measures such as hot wire or enclosure fencing to prevent egress. The animal was able
to be returned to the enclosure safely with no injury while the facility was closed to the public. The facility initiated
protocols to keep the animals contained in the enclosure while installing additional fencing to keep the animals secure.
Corrected by the time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 25 August 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On 02 August 2025, an approximately 1-year-old female Red-crested finch was unable to be found in an outdoor walk-
through aviary during morning observation checks. The bird had a history of getting into a keeper hallway and separate 
large bird (vulture) portion of the aviary since acquisition and release into the aviary in May 2025. The facility assessed 
the construction of the aviary and made repairs where gaps existed between dividing poles and netting within the aviary to 
separate the two groups of birds.  
 
Despite recovery efforts, the facility was unable to locate the bird or determine the cause of disappearance. The facility 
patched areas of the semi-rigid plastic mesh enclosure material in disrepair and an area with minor gaps at the base of 
the aviary wall, but a facility representative stated they did not think the areas they identified were large enough to allow 
the bird to escape. The facility reports that ongoing corrective action measures are in place, including addressing a larger 
gap (approximately 2.5 inches) at the base of the enclosure identified by the inspector during inspection. 
 
The facility must ensure that bird enclosures are maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds, 
and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 25 August 2025. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
On the morning of 05 March 2025, Msituni, a 3-year-old female giraffe jumped out of the giraffe enclosure by clearing an 
approximately 5-foot 10-inch vertical earth wall present on one side of the enclosure. The location that was breached did 
not have additional containment measures such as hot wire or enclosure fencing to prevent egress. The animal was able 
to be returned to the enclosure safely with no injury while the facility was closed to the public. The facility initiated 
protocols to keep the animals contained in the enclosure while installing additional fencing to keep the animals secure. 
Corrected by the time of inspection.  
 
Correct from this date forward of 25 August 2025.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
